page.title: 06ECOLOGY - SHIRTCLIFF BROOK
page.content: Shirtcliff Brook is situated in a valley between Woodhouse and Stradbroke. In the valley are many trees and animals. The valley is crawling with nature. There is a nature trail which begins at Shubert Bridge and ends up in Smelter Wood. The brook is very shallow, about l4 cm deep, and contains little amphibious life compared to the more polluted area near the Badger Estate.At one point ochre enters the stream but does not pollute it.Housing estates will not be built because of subsidence.Opposite the Severnside area is an expanse of ground.This was a mine but is now just an old piece of wasteland. You can still see the old stones from the mine.
